com.nimsoft.nimbus
Class NimUtility

java.lang.Object
  com.nimsoft.nimbus.NimUtility

public class NimUtility
extends Object

Utility methods to display PDS objects, interpret time formats strings as set in configuration files, etc.

displayHex

public static String displayHex(byte[] bytes,
                                int inrow)
Write the given byte array to a String containing comma-separated hexadecimal values representing each byte (e.g. "0x00,0x01,0x02").

Parameters:
bytes - the bytes to display
inrow - the number of bytes to write before writing a newline (number of bytes in a single line/row)

displayHex

public static String displayHex(byte[] bytes,
                                int length,
                                int inrow)
Write the given byte array to a String containing comma-separated hexadecimal values representing each byte (e.g. "0x00,0x01,0x02").

Parameters:
bytes - the bytes to write
length - the maximum number of bytes to write
inrow - the number of bytes to write before writing a newline (number of bytes in a single line/row)

bytesToHexString

public static String bytesToHexString(byte[] bytes)
Write the given byte array to a hexadecimal String representation (e.g. "000102").

Parameters:
bytes - the bytes to write

bytesToHexString

public static String bytesToHexString(byte[] bytes,
                                      int offset,
                                      int length)
Write the specified byte array segment to a hexadecimal String representation (e.g. "000102").

Parameters:
bytes - the array containing bytes to write
offset - the offset of the first byte within the array to write
length - the number of bytes to write
Returns:
the hexadecimal String representing the given byte array segment

hexStringToBytes

public static byte[] hexStringToBytes(String hex)
Convert the given hexadecimal String to an array of bytes (e.g. hexStringToBytes("000102") would return the byte array { 0 1 2 }).

Parameters:
hex - the hexadecimal String to convert to a byte array
Returns:
the byte array interpretation of the hexadecimal String

public static boolean isNotEmpty(String str)
Return true if the given String is not null or empty. This is the same as !NimUtility.isEmpty(str).

str - the String to test
Returns:
true if the given String is not empty, otherwise false

getIntervalInMillis

public static int getIntervalInMillis(String interval)
Return the given interval converted to milliseconds, or -1 if the given interval is null or not recognized.

Parameters:
interval - the interval as a string (e.g. "10min".)
Returns:
the interval as a number of milliseconds.
